title: What is Syracuse University impact on the local economy ? ( Good Morning CNY for Jan . 6 )
body_text:
Subscribe to get the Good Morning, CNY newsletter delivered to your email inbox weekday mornings.
Weather
High: 40. Low: 35. Cloudy with some afternoon rain. See the 5-day forecast.
Photo of the day
Otisco home burns: A home in the town of Otisco burned was destroyed by fire on Sunday, and was still smoldering 24 hours later. The house suffered a total loss, firefighters said. The structure collapsed into the basement, leaving no frame standing. Story, more photos. (Photo courtesy Mottville Fire Department)
The latest
Syracuse school board’s push to oust member rare in Central NY: The Syracuse City School Board of Education are trying to remove commissioner Twiggy Billue, a rare process that longtime city and county officials have not seen. “Usually vacancies happen when somebody gets a job or we’ve had deaths. This is a weird one,“ said Dustin Czarny, the Onondaga County Election Commissioner since 2013. ”I don’t remember a removal from a local committee.”
What’s trending
What is Syracuse University’s impact on the local economy? Just what kind of economic impact does Syracuse University have on Central New York? The school commissioned Lightcast, a global consulting firm, to examine the university’s impact from the 2023-2024 academic year and prior years. The report analyzes how the cost of operating a large research university ripples through the region, including student spending, construction expenses and the visitors that SU brings to Syracuse, among other factors. Here’s what the report says.
What will Sharon Owens’ administration look like? A lot like Ben Walsh’s: Sharon Owens said she does not have time for learning curves. That’s a primary reason why Syracuse’s new mayor has filled her administration’s key leadership positions with people she’s already worked alongside during Mayor Ben Walsh’s eight years in office. After saying during the campaign that she’d look for opportunities to bring some new people into city government, she’s choosing to start with what’s essentially a reshuffling of the Walsh administration’s top decision-makers.
Wegmans collecting biometric data at some stores for security purposes: Wegmans is at the center of a privacy controversy after signs were posted at their New York City locations notifying customers biometric data was being collected in the stores. Asked by syracuse.com | The Post-Standard if it is using the technology at Central New York stores, Wegmans did not directly answer the question.
Looking ahead
What to do this week in CNY: Welcome to 2026; the new year The week ahead of us is a busy one as we transition from the holidays. Here are a dozen Central New York events this week that you don’t want to miss.
- Syracuse music venue sets concerts for final blowout weekend
- Get 5 gallons of popcorn for $5 at this Upstate NY movie theater
Sports
Preseason poll forecasts SU as one of top men’s lacrosse teams in country: Will the Syracuse men’s lacrosse team contend for a national championship this season? USA Lacrosse Magazine seems to think so. The publication has released its preseason poll and the Orange are ranked very high.
Dominique Darius has the jersey number, the name and the game to match her NFL father: Donovin Darius, who starred as a safety for the Syracuse football team before becoming a first-round pick by the Jacksonville Jaguars in the 1998 NFL Draft, never pushed his daughter Dominique to follow in his steps and attend SU. But after stints at UCLA and USC, Dominique now dons the No. 20 like her father once did – and is helping spark the 13-2 Orange women’s basketball team as its point guard.
